meanings.definition: To produce or form buds or gemmae.
meanings.sent1: The plant gemmated new buds in the spring.
meanings.sent2: The flower gemmated beautiful petals as it bloomed.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to be gemmated with tiny surprises waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas gemmated into a full-fledged project over time.
meanings.sent5: The tree gemmated fresh leaves, painting the landscape in vibrant green hues.

meanings.definition: To be in the bud or germ; to sprout.
meanings.sent1: The seeds gemmated slowly under the soil, preparing to grow.
meanings.sent2: The idea gemmated in his mind before blossoming into a plan.
meanings.sent3: The mystery gemmated in her mind, waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: His talent gemmated quietly until it burst forth in a brilliant performance.
meanings.sent5: The hope gemmated within her, filling her with anticipation for the future.
